programme.desc: Includes live performances from Tim McGraw and Faith Hill's 2017 Soul2Soul world tour, as well as an intimate look inside their relationship. Never before seen interviews are presented along side behind-the-scenes footage, capturing their chemistry on and off the stage. Directed and executive produced by the award-winning team of Dan Cutforth and Jane Lipsitz.(n)

programme.title: Tron
programme.desc: When a brilliant video game maker named Flynn (Jeff Bridges) hacks the mainframe of his ex-employer, he is beamed inside a digital world and becomes part of the very game he is designing.(n)

programme.title: The Art of the Steal
programme.desc: This eye-opening documentary tells the story of the Barnes Collection, $25 billion worth of masterpieces by Cezanne, Matisse and Renoir that has become the focus of a culture war between those who wish to preserve the intentions of the collection's original owner, and a conspiracy of politically powerful corporations seeking to profit by seizing and relocating the artwork.(n)

programme.title: Christmas Ranch
programme.desc: When a rebellious young girl is sent to stay on her grandmother's ranch for Christmas, a friendship with a pony alters the course of her life but when the ranch is threatened with foreclosure she must come up with a plan to save horse and home.(n)

programme.title: I Am Giant: Victor Cruz
programme.desc: Documentary chronicling Victor Cruz's improbable rise to football stardom, the life shattering injury that derailed his career and his dramatic attempt at a comeback, revealing the man behind the mask, as he faces the biggest challenge of his life.(n)

programme.title: Cupid's Proxy
programme.desc: Rebecca Murphy is a cynical widow whose whole world revolves around her 12 year old son, Justin - a budding musician who can't remember his late father. Rebecca has no desire to date despite efforts by her feisty neighbor, Olive, who has a love advice column called Call Me Cupid. When Olive is pressured by her editor to get with the times, she enlists Justin to help her answer a letter. Unbeknownst to Justin, she publishes his advice under the alter ego, Cupid's Proxy.(n)

programme.title: The Preacher's Wife
programme.desc: Denzel Washington stars as an angel named Dudley sent to Earth to help a minister's marriage (Courtney B. Vance) to his wife (Whitney Houston). Things take a twist when Dudley accidentally falls in love with her.(n)

programme.title: Tron
programme.desc: When a brilliant video game maker named Flynn (Jeff Bridges) hacks the mainframe of his ex-employer, he is beamed inside a digital world and becomes part of the very game he is designing.(n)

programme.title: Cody the Robosapien
programme.desc: When a 12-year-old boy discovers a broken robot, he finds a zany and powerful new best friend who can change his life for the better but when the evil corporation that funded the robot's creation intervenes, the pair must team up to save their family.(n)

programme.title: ATM
programme.desc: After leaving a party together, coworkers David (Brian Geraghty), Emily (Alice Eve) and Corey (Josh Peck) stop at an ATM. Pulling into a desolate parking lot, Corey gets out to get cash and a routine transaction turns into a struggle for survival when an unknown man appears outside blocking their exit. With the wintry temperatures dipping below freezing, and the morning sunrise still hours away, they have no choice but to play the man's deadly game of cat-and-mouse.
Belle's ability to separate work from pleasure is tested when she meets an alluring and dangerous new client; Poppy's curiosity gets the better of her, and she ends up wishing it hadn't.

credits.director: Adult Content, Adult Language, Strong Sexual Content

programme.title: Palm Swings
programme.desc: Married couple Allison and Mark Hughes moving into their new Palm Springs home. Claire and Jim Ericson are their charismatic new neighbors. Claire, a sensual ex-model, and Jim, a music producer, embody the passionate marriage that Allison wants. Unable to sleep one night, Allison spies with her camera a woman arriving to meet Jim next door. Allison investigates and discovers their neighbors are swingers. Her and Mark get more than they bargained for when their wild adventures threaten to destroy their marriage.

programme.title: Pretty Persuasion
programme.desc: When high school student Kimberly Joyce accuses her English teacher of sexual harassment, she turns her exclusive Beverly Hills private school, and everything else in her wake, upside down. Hell hath no fury like a teenager scorned.

programme.title: London Town
programme.desc: When fifteen-year-old Shay (Daniel Huttlestone) hears the music of The Clash for the first time, it's a revelation, opening up a new world of anti-establishment defiance beyond anything he's known in his dead-end London suburb. Drawn into the heart of the city's burgeoning punk scene, he forges two relationships that will change his life: falling in love with rebellious cool girl Vivian (Nell Williams) and finding an unexpected connection with none other than The Clash's electrifying frontman, Joe Strummer (Jonathan Rhys Meyers).

programme.title: Sister
programme.desc: After the death of his father, a young man whose life is falling apart, returns to his hometown to take care of his mentally ill sister, and tries to save her, while also saving himself.

programme.title: Life Is Beautiful (La vita e bella)
programme.desc: Guido is a charming, bumbling Jewish waiter whose colorful imagination and playful spirit help him to woo a beautiful schoolteacher. The couple marries and has a young son, but before long, their idyllic world is threatened by Nazi soldiers who force the family into a concentration camp. Guido must now use his imagination again - this time to transform his son's tragic new surroundings into a magical wonderland.

programme.title: Terms of Endearment
programme.desc: Hard-to-please Aurora (Shirley MacLaine) is looking for love, while her daughter (Debra Winger) has her own set of family problems. Also starring Jack Nicholson.

programme.title: Don't Knock Twice
programme.desc: A successful sculptor named Jess returns to the UK to rebuild her relationship with Chloe, the daughter she was forced to give up nine years ago. When she agrees to come and live with her, Jess learns that Chloe has not come to stay because she wants to get to know her mother again. She has come because she is scared that a supernatural curse has claimed the life of her boyfriend, Danny, and is now coming for her. Chloe and Danny made the mistake of visiting an abandoned house once home to a witch, that comes for you if you knock on the door.

programme.title: Band Aid
programme.desc: Anna (Zoe Lister-Jones) and Ben (Adam Pally) are a couple who can't stop fighting. Advised by their therapist to try and work through their grief unconventionally, they are reminded of their shared love of music. In a last-ditch effort to save their marriage, they decide to turn all their fights into song, and with the help of their neighbor Dave (Fred Armisen), they start a band.

programme.title: Queen of the Desert
programme.desc: Gertrude Bell (Nicole Kidman) rejects the stifling rigidity of life in turn-of-the-century England, leaving it behind for a chance to travel to Tehran. She begins her lifelong adventure across the Arab world, a journey marked by danger, a passionate affair with a British officer (James Franco), and an encounter with the legendary T.E. Lawrence (Robert Pattinson).

programme.title: Life Is Beautiful (La vita e bella)
programme.desc: Guido is a charming, bumbling Jewish waiter whose colorful imagination and playful spirit help him to woo a beautiful schoolteacher. The couple marries and has a young son, but before long, their idyllic world is threatened by Nazi soldiers who force the family into a concentration camp. Guido must now use his imagination again - this time to transform his son's tragic new surroundings into a magical wonderland.

programme.title: Terms of Endearment
programme.desc: Hard-to-please Aurora (Shirley MacLaine) is looking for love, while her daughter (Debra Winger) has her own set of family problems. Also starring Jack Nicholson.
Belle is determined to help Poppy come to terms with recent revelations, but Poppy has other ideas; a cruel trick from dominatrix Charlotte leaves Belle in a somewhat awkward position.(c)

credits.director: Adult Content, Adult Language, Strong Sexual Content, Brief Nudity

programme.title: Certain Women
programme.desc: Michelle Williams, Kristen Stewart and Laura Dern star as three women striving to forge their own paths amidst the wide-open plains of the American Northwest. The lawyer (Dern) finds herself contending with both office sexism and a hostage situation. The wife and mother (Williams) has determination to build her dream home which puts her at odds with the men in her life. The young law student (Stewart) forms an ambiguous bond with a lonely ranch hand (Lily Gladstone).

programme.title: Queen of the Desert
programme.desc: Gertrude Bell (Nicole Kidman) rejects the stifling rigidity of life in turn-of-the-century England, leaving it behind for a chance to travel to Tehran. She begins her lifelong adventure across the Arab world, a journey marked by danger, a passionate affair with a British officer (James Franco), and an encounter with the legendary T.E. Lawrence (Robert Pattinson).

programme.title: Strip Club Slayer
programme.desc: When a strip club goer is killed, the dancers hire a bouncer to protect themselves. As the sexual tension grows between one of the women and the bouncer, the mystery of the dangerous killer unravels.

programme.title: Rabid
programme.desc: After a young woman has a motorcycle accident that leads to experimental surgery to save her life, she develops a taste for blood that spurs a city-wide zombie epidemic.

programme.title: The Free World
programme.desc: After spending two decades in prison for a crime he didn't commit, Mo (Boyd Holbrook) struggles to put his past behind him and readjust to a new life. Doris (Elisabeth Moss) is trapped in another sort of prison: an abusive marriage. When a dramatic encounter brings them together, Mo soon finds himself risking everything—including being locked up once again for someone else's crime—to protect the fragile Doris. Academy Award® winner Octavia Spencer and Sung Kang costar.

programme.title: Lost Cat Corona
programme.desc: Dominic likes to play it safe, but Dom's M.O. is tested when his wife's cat goes missing and he sets out on a quest to find him. Over the course of one day, Dom endures neighborhood mayhem at every turn. He meets a deranged psychopath, endures a sideshow of a wake, and becomes unwittingly involved in the exchange of illegal knockoff handbags. As the day nears the end, a confrontation with a pair of badass teens forces Dom to face the issues that have been holding him hostage his entire life.

programme.title: The Sense of an Ending
programme.desc: Tony Webster (Jim Broadbent) lives a reclusive existence in London, until he learns that a diary has been left to him by the recently deceased mother (Emily Mortimer) of an ex-girlfriend (Charlotte Rampling). As Webster investigates the diary, he is forced to face the truth about his first love and the consequences of decisions made a lifetime ago, while attempting to resolve his strained relationships with his ex-wife (Harriet Walter) and their pregnant daughter (Michelle Dockery).

programme.title: Becoming Cary Grant
programme.desc: Using words from his unpublished autobiography along with newly-discovered personal footage shot with a film-maker's eye, Cary Grant - one of Hollywood's greatest stars - tells his story himself. Exploring his long journey from childhood poverty to global fame, this radically new perspective of a man on a quest to find the love that eluded him most of his life reveals the man behind the mask of subtle charm and suave sophistication.

programme.title: The Babadook
programme.desc: Six years after the violent death of her husband, Amelia (Essie Davis) is at a loss. She struggles to discipline her out-of-control son, Samuel (Noah Wiseman), who she finds impossible to love. Samuel's dreams are plagued by a monster he believes is coming to kill them both. When a disturbing storybook turns up at their house, Samuel is convinced that the Babadook is the creature he's been dreaming about. His hallucinations spiral out of control, he becomes more unpredictable and violent.

programme.title: Drugstore Cowboy
programme.desc: Without adopting the romantic and moralistic cliches that have crippled many other films about addiction, Gus Van Sant directs Matt Dillon, Kelly Lynch, James Le Gros and Heather Graham in one of the most influential films of the late 1980s. Bob (Dillon) is the leader of a small gang of junkies that robs pharmacies and hospitals for prescription drugs. Alas, Bob is now starting to feel the burden of responsibility as he watches over his band of misfits. Van Sant's joyous and exhilarating second feature is notable for its humor and bravery.

programme.title: The Weather Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage stars in this comedy-drama as a Chicago weather man whose personal life enters free-fall even as his career is potentially about to take off with a new job on a national television morning show. Michael Caine and Hope Davis costar in this film from director Gore Verbinski ("The Ring," "Pirates of the Caribbean").

programme.title: The Rendezvous
programme.desc: Rachel, a Jewish-American doctor and Jake, an Arab-American government bureaucrat, are trying to solve the mysterious death of Rachel's brother. Racing around the world, they find themselves hunted by a doomsday group. The group believes Rachel and Jake possess an ancient script discovered by Rachel's brother that could bring about the end of days. Caught in the middle of a plot to hasten the end of mankind, Rachel and Jake must solve a murder and save the world.

programme.title: The Sense of an Ending
programme.desc: Tony Webster (Jim Broadbent) lives a reclusive existence in London, until he learns that a diary has been left to him by the recently deceased mother (Emily Mortimer) of an ex-girlfriend (Charlotte Rampling). As Webster investigates the diary, he is forced to face the truth about his first love and the consequences of decisions made a lifetime ago, while attempting to resolve his strained relationships with his ex-wife (Harriet Walter) and their pregnant daughter (Michelle Dockery).(n)

programme.title: Drugstore Cowboy
programme.desc: Without adopting the romantic and moralistic cliches that have crippled many other films about addiction, Gus Van Sant directs Matt Dillon, Kelly Lynch, James Le Gros and Heather Graham in one of the most influential films of the late 1980s. Bob (Dillon) is the leader of a small gang of junkies that robs pharmacies and hospitals for prescription drugs. Alas, Bob is now starting to feel the burden of responsibility as he watches over his band of misfits. Van Sant's joyous and exhilarating second feature is notable for its humor and bravery.(n)

programme.title: Mercy (2010)
programme.desc: A writer (Scott Caan) of highly sentimental love stories is secretly a womanizing cynic who has never actually experienced love, until he meets the beautiful and shockingly straightforward critic Mercy (Wendy Glenn), who is not fooled by his phony mawkishness. Erika Christensen costars in this romantic drama.(n)

programme.title: Death Becomes Her
programme.desc: Academy Award®-winning director Robert Zemeckis creates an adventure about two women, Academy Award®-winners Meryl Streep and Goldie Hawn, determined to win the heart of the same man, Bruce Willis. When they both drink an immortality potion, their mutual murder plans get a little complicated.(n)

programme.title: The Architect
programme.desc: Parker Posey and Eric McCormack star in this comedy about a couple who set out to build a new home and enlist the services of an uncompromising modernist architect who proceeds to build his dream house, instead of theirs.(n)

programme.title: Away From Her
programme.desc: A lovingly devoted couple feel their unshakable longtime bond begin to unravel thanks to the ravages of Alzheimer's Disease in this remarkable tour-de-force of acting and powerfully emotional writing from first-time director Sarah Polley. Gordon Pinsent, Julie Christie and Olympia Dukakis star.(n)

programme.title: Skybound
programme.desc: Five plane passengers are unable to land after a gigantic disaster happens on the ground.(n)

programme.title: Autumn In New York
programme.desc: A wealthy, charismatic New York restaurateur (Richard Gere) falls for a much younger hat designer (Winona Ryder) but their relationship is complicated by his philandering ways, his past connection to her family, and her debilitating illness. Jill Hennessey, Anthony LaPaglia, Sherry Stringfield and Elaine Stritch costar in this romantic melodrama.(n)

programme.title: Sleepless
programme.desc: When Las Vegas cop Vincent Downs (Jamie Foxx) and his partner Sean (Tip "T.I." Harris) rob a cocaine shipment bound for a drug-dealing casino boss (Dermot Mulroney), the desperate businessman retaliates by kidnapping Vincent's son (Octavius J. Johnson). Pursued by a dogged Internal Affairs investigator (Michelle Monaghan) and a sadistic drug kingpin (Scoot McNairy), Vincent must rely on his street smarts and sheer force of will as he tries to rescue his child over the course of a single night. Directed by Baran bo Odar.(n)

programme.title: Jenny's Wedding
programme.desc: Jenny Farrell has led an openly gay life with everyone except her family. She has kept it a secret out of compassion for her parents, knowing they are happiest living in a small, safe and familiar world. Realizing she is missing out on having a full life, Jenny decides to marry Kitty, a woman they thought was her roommate. Her parents are shocked to find out how little they know their daughter and fear becoming the object of gossip in their small community. Misunderstanding leads to misunderstanding, and long-standing grudges are revealed.(n)

programme.title: Bad Moms
programme.desc: Over-worked, over-committed and exhausted, Amy joins forces with two other stressed moms on a quest to liberate themselves from conventional responsibilities - going on a long overdue binge of freedom and fun that puts them on a collision course with the head of the PTA and her clique of perfect moms.(n)

Shane, a Jersey boy with big dreams, crosses the river in hopes of finding a more exciting life at Studio 54. When Steve Rubell, the mastermind behind the infamous disco, plucks Shane from the sea of faces, Shane lands a coveted job.(n)

programme.title: Mona Lisa Smile
programme.desc: In 1953, a time when women's roles are rigidly defined, novice art history professor Katherine Watson begins teaching at the prestigious all-female Wellesley College, which despite its academic reputation, is an environment where success is measured by how well the students marry. Encouraging these women to strive for a more enlightened future, Watson challenges the administration and inspires her students to look beyond the image of what is, and consider the possibilities of what could be.(n)

programme.title: Autumn In New York
programme.desc: A wealthy, charismatic New York restaurateur (Richard Gere) falls for a much younger hat designer (Winona Ryder) but their relationship is complicated by his philandering ways, his past connection to her family, and her debilitating illness. Jill Hennessey, Anthony LaPaglia, Sherry Stringfield and Elaine Stritch costar in this romantic melodrama.(n)

programme.title: Maisie
programme.desc: A wisecracking, street-smart showgirl is stranded in Wyoming, where she takes a job at a carnival shooting gallery, meets a handsome ranch foreman and gets involved in a murder. This was the first of 10 "Maisie" films featuring Ann Sothern. (cc).

programme.title: Congo Maisie
programme.desc: The second entry in the "Maisie" series finds the brassy wisecracking showgirl stowing away on an ocean steamer and winding up stranded on a rubber plantation in West Africa, where she attempts to thwart an attack by a restless local native tribe. (cc).

programme.title: Gold Rush Maisie
programme.desc: In the third entry in the series, the wisecracking showgirl gets stuck in a deserted mining camp and hooks up with an impoverished migrant family that is hoping to strike it rich. (cc).

programme.title: Maisie Was a Lady
programme.desc: In this second entry in the series, the Brooklyn showgirl loses her carnival job and becomes a housemaid for a family of well-to-do eccentrics and squares off against the house's imperious head butler. (cc).

programme.title: Ringside Maisie
programme.desc: Once again broke and stranded, showgirl Maisie takes a dancing job at an Adirondacks resort, where she gets involved with an up-and-coming prizefighter and his manager. Fifth entry in the series. The boxer is played by Robert Sterling, who would later marry "Maisie" star Ann Sothern in real life. (cc).

programme.title: Maisie Gets Her Man
programme.desc: Broke and stranded yet again, Brooklyn showgirl Maisie attempts to aid an amateur vaudevillian comic she has fallen in love with in the sixth entry in the series. (cc).

programme.title: Swing Shift Maisie
programme.desc: Seventh entry in the series has the Brooklyn showgirl quitting a dog act to work at an aircraft plant during WWII, where she falls for a test pilot, though he has his eyes on a seemingly suicidal coworker. (cc).

programme.title: Maisie Goes to Reno
programme.desc: In the eighth entry in the series, the globe-trotting chorus girl arrives in Nevada for some rest and relaxation, but is soon entangled in other people's problems and relationships. (cc).

programme.title: Up Goes Maisie
programme.desc: The worldly-wise showgirl goes to work as a secretary for an inventor and has a number of wild adventures in his latest creation, a revolutionary new helicopter. (cc).

programme.title: Undercover Maisie
programme.desc: Final entry in the series has the perennially stranded showgirl working with the Los Angeles Police Department to stop a gang of con men who are led by a phony swami. (cc).

programme.title: Look Who's Laughing
programme.desc: When Edgar Bergen and Charlie McCarthy are forced to land in the community of Wistful Vista, the wild fun begins. Lucille Ball. Fibber McGee: Jim Jordan. Molly: Marian Jordan. Directed by Allan Dwan. (cc).

programme.title: Here We Go Again
programme.desc: Radio favorites Fibber McGee and Molly venture away from their hometown of Wistful Vista to enjoy a sentimental second honeymoon, but their romantic getaway is interrupted by many colorful personalities, including ventriloquist's dummy Charlie McCarthy. (cc).

programme.title: The Great Gildersleeve
programme.desc: Gildy (Harold Peary) finds himself the target of an old maid. Emma: Jane Darwell. Amelia: Mary Field. Margie: Nancy Gates. LeRoy: Freddie Mercer. Hooker: Charles Arnt. Governor: Thurston Hall. (cc).

programme.title: Gildersleeve's Bad Day
programme.desc: Gildersleeve (Harold Peary) is accused of bribe-taking when he's the only juror to defend a thug. Aunt Emma: Jane Darwell. Margie: Nancy Gates. Judge: Charles Arnt. For devotees of the old radio show. (cc).

programme.title: Gildersleeve on Broadway
programme.desc: The radio character (Harold Peary) has inane encounters with a rich widow (Billie Burke) and a blonde siren (Claire Carleton). Matilda: Ann Doran. Peavey: Richard LeGrand. Leroy: Freddy Mercer. Short on laughs. (cc).

programme.title: Gildersleeve's Ghost
programme.desc: Running for police commissioner, Gildy (Harold Peary) gets involved with a doc's research and an invisible woman (Marion Martin). Marie: Amelita Ward. Leroy: Freddie Mercer. Peavey: Richard LeGrand.

programme.title: Private Screenings
programme.desc: The tables are turned as regular series host Robert Osborne is interviewed by Alec Baldwin. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Dodsworth
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee is an adaptation of the Sinclair Lewis novel about a rich couple's marriage unraveling during a grand tour of Europe, where she takes up with a minor member of royalty and he falls for an attractive widow. (cc).

programme.title: Robert Osborne's 20th Anniversary Tribute
programme.desc: A celebration of Turner Classic Movie host Robert Osborne's 20 years at the cable network. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Laura
programme.desc: A New York City detective investigates the slaying of a beloved ad exec and the more he learns about her---from her mentor, her fiancé, her diary, her maid and the haunting portrait in her apartment---the more he, too, comes under her spell. John LaShelle's atmospheric black-and-white cinematography won an Oscar, and nominations went to director Otto Preminger, supporting actor Clifton Webb and the screenplay. (cc).

programme.title: Private Screenings
programme.desc: Liza Minnelli discusses her film and Broadway roles, her early influences, and her famous parents, Vincente Minnelli and Judy Garland. Included are clips of her and her mother's film and TV performances. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Private Screenings
programme.desc: Host Robert Osborne chats with Ernest Borgnine, Oscar winner ("Marty") and best-selling author ("Ernie: An Autobiography"), about his personal and professional life. Included are clips from Borgnine's 50-plus year career in films and television. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Private Screenings
programme.desc: The tables are turned as regular series host Robert Osborne is interviewed by Alec Baldwin. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: We Go to Monte Carlo
programme.desc: Audrey Hepburn has a minor role in this farce about two babies sent to the wrong people through a mixup. Antoine: Jules Munshin. Max: Russell Collins. Marinette: Cara Williams. Philippe: Philippe Lemaire. Rudy: John van Dreelen. Impresario: Marcel Dalio. Jacqueline: Michele Farmer (Gloria Swanson's daughter). Ray Ventura orchestra. Jean Boyer, Lester Fuller directed.

programme.title: Love in the Afternoon

programme.desc: A twentysomething slacker (writer-director Zach Braff) faces his estranged family when he returns to New Jersey for his mother's funeral. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Wish I Was Here
programme.desc: A 35-year-old father who's never quite grown up learns about life when he's forced to homeschool his kids, since their grandfather can no longer afford their private-school tuition and their public school is a mess. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Shopgirl
programme.desc: Steve Martin adapted his novella and stars in this perceptive and bittersweet triangle tale involving a millionaire, an aspiring artist (Claire Danes) and a slacker (Jason Schwartzman). Bridgette Wilson-Sampras, Sam Bottoms. Directed by Anand Tucker. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Very Bad Things *
programme.desc: Things go from very bad to worse at a Las Vegas bachelor party where a prostitute is accidentally killed and the attendees decide to cover up the death. (cc).

programme.title: Alien Resurrection
programme.desc: Ellen Ripley is back in the "Alien" saga's fourth installment. Here she returns from the dead, courtesy of cloning, to battle more vicious beasts. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: A driven police detective and his partner track down a major international drug dealer. They begin by following a couple they suspect because the duo lives far above their apparent means. They continue to follow a trail of clues that leads to a French criminal responsible for a large percentage of the drugs that come into New York City. Best Picture winner. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Run Fatboy Run
programme.desc: An English layabout goes to great lengths to win back the pregnant woman he abandoned on their wedding day five years earlier. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Live by Night
programme.desc: Joe Coughlin, the son of a Boston police lieutenant, moves to Florida during the Prohibition era to become a bootlegger. As his operation grows, Coughlin faces off against local gangsters, Klansmen and religious evangelicals while he fights for control of Tampa's criminal underworld. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Omen
programme.desc: A U.S. diplomat secretly adopts a baby boy after his son dies at birth and slowly begins to realize that the child is the Antichrist when death and destruction follow in his wake. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: She's Out of My League
programme.desc: A kindhearted but socially awkward airport security agent wins the affections of a gorgeous party planner and vows to make the relationship work, despite the misgivings of his friends and family. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Under the Tuscan Sun *
programme.desc: A bitter, divorced writer finds solace and romance after she impulsively buys and renovates a villa in Tuscany. Screenplay adapted from the memoir by Frances Mayes. (cc).

programme.title: Atomic Blonde
programme.desc: In this spy thriller set in 1989 Berlin, MI6 agent Lorraine Broughton must obtain a stolen list of Western spies while the city around her descends into chaos and revolution. In time, her pursuit leads her to uncover a much-larger conspiracy. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Time Traveler's Wife
programme.desc: Dramatic fantasy about a librarian whose genetic disorder causes him to hurtle through time when under extreme duress. Despite this condition, he tries to build a relationship with a young heiress. Based on the best-selling novel by author Audrey Niffenegger. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Omen
programme.desc: A U.S. diplomat secretly adopts a baby boy after his son dies at birth and slowly begins to realize that the child is the Antichrist when death and destruction follow in his wake. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Damien Omen II
programme.desc: As the Antichrist comes of age, he is mentored by a Satanic disciple; and anyone who surmises or gets close to his true identity is eliminated. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Omen IV The Awakening
programme.desc: The daughter of the original Devil's child Damian uses her inborn demonic power to lead her adopted family to political power to unheard of heights. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Final Conflict
programme.desc: The Antichrist has garnered an ambassadorship when he sees a trio of stars, which indicates the Second Coming, prompting him to order the slaying of infants born on a designated date, even that of his faithful private secretary. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Latin Explosion A New America
programme.desc: John Leguizamo narrates a look at the growing influence of Latino culture and music in the U.S. from the 1950s to the 21st century that features footage of vintage performances and remarks by artists and entertainers, including Marc Anthony, Gloria Estefan, José Feliciano, Eva Longoria, Jennifer Lopez, Ricky Martin, Rita Moreno, Pitbull, Shakira and Sofía Vergara. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Off-Air
programme.desc: (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Deceived
programme.desc: A Manhattan art restorer who believes she has the perfect marriage uncovers secrets about her husband after his mysterious death. Her sleuthing threatens to bring about her own demise. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Hours
programme.desc: Three women, separated by 80 years, struggle with similar crises linked by the novel Mrs. Dalloway. Author Virginia Woolf attempts to start writing that novel, a '50s housewife contemplates leaving her life behind and a modern-day book editor cares for a former boyfriend who's fighting AIDS. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
programme.desc: Bill Paxton directed this rousing drama about a working-class amateur golfer (Shia LaBeouf) who challenges the sport's reigning champ (Stephen Dillane) in the 1913 U.S. Open. Writer and producer Mark Frost adapted the screenplay from his own best-selling account of the event. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Beguiled
programme.desc: In this Civil War drama, a deserter from the Union Army seeks refuge at an all-female boarding school in Virginia, where the ladies compete for his affections while tending to his injuries. His presence at the school slowly poisons the relationships between the various women, who eventually turn on the soldier. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: I Am Evidence
programme.desc: This documentary examines the fact that thousands of rape kits in the United States go untested each year, and looks at efforts to combat this injustice. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Great Wall
programme.desc: In 11th-century China, two mercenaries from the West are captured by a military organization that are headquartered in a fortress on the Great Wall. In time, the duo get caught up in a battle between the Chinese warriors and a supernatural menace that the Great Wall was built to repel. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Diary *
programme.desc: The romantic adventures of a thirtysomething Brit (Renee Zellweger) determined to find Mr. Right while cutting back on her smoking, drinking and eating. Charming and spirited. Hugh Grant, Colin Firth. A stellar Zellweger was nominated for a Best Actress Oscar. She perfected a British accent and gained 20 pounds for the role. Based on Helen Fielding's novel and followed by the 2004 sequel, “Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason.” Sharon Maguire directed. (cc).

programme.title: Everything, Everything
programme.desc: A teenage girl is unable to leave her home because she has an immunodeficiency that makes her allergic to almost everything. However, her life changes for the better when she begins to communicate with the boy next door, and their relationship eventually inspires her to venture into the outside world. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Beguiled
programme.desc: In this Civil War drama, a deserter from the Union Army seeks refuge at an all-female boarding school in Virginia, where the ladies compete for his affections while tending to his injuries. His presence at the school slowly poisons the relationships between the various women, who eventually turn on the soldier. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Kong Skull Island
programme.desc: A disillusioned soldier and a photojournalist join an expedition to Skull Island, an uncharted territory in the Pacific. There, the group get caught up in an ongoing war between a gigantic ape called King Kong and the area's indigenous predators. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: Segments include a one-on-one interview with Miami Marlins CEO Derek Jeter; a spotlight on coaching abuse among the top NCAA programs; and a feature on the Nebraska Cornhuskers women's bowling team. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Maps to the Stars
programme.desc: A high-powered Hollywood family unravel after their troubled daughter returns home, years after causing a fire that nearly killed her brother. Meanwhile, the daughter develops a relationship with a limo driver, and an aging actress pines for a role that she was born to play. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Engrossing, fact-based story of journalist Stephen Glass, whose up-and-coming career at the New Republic and other magazines came to a screeching halt when it was discovered that he fabricated stories. Hayden Christensen, Peter Sarsgaard, Chloe Sevigny, Rosario Dawson, Melanie Lynskey, Hank Azaria. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: A Girl in the River The Price of Forgiveness
programme.desc: The story of an 18-year-old Pakistani girl who was targeted for death by her family but survived. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Mooseport
programme.desc: In a Maine town, a former U.S. president and a handyman vie for the mayor's office and a local woman's affections. The ex-president retires to the small town in order to write his memoirs, but winds up running for mayor against a hardware store owner. Complicating matters is the political bigwig's interest in the handyman's girlfriend. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Book of Henry
programme.desc: A young boy learns that his next-door neighbor is being abused by her stepfather, and starts writing a book about how to rescue her. When his mother discovers his plans, she decides to enact them herself. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Wish I Was Here
programme.desc: A 35-year-old father who's never quite grown up learns about life when he's forced to homeschool his kids, since their grandfather can no longer afford their private-school tuition and their public school is a mess. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Snatched
programme.desc: A free-spirited woman convinces her anxious mother to join her on a vacation to South America she'd been planning with her beau before they broke up. However, their trip turns into a wild adventure when they escape from an attempted kidnapping. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: After a pilot crashes in the harsh terrain of the Gobi Desert, he and his crew try to rebuild the cargo plane and fly it to safety. But, the survivors have to learn to work together before completing such a monumental task. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Westworld
programme.desc: A look back at the beginning. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Everything Is Copy - Nora Ephron Scripted & Unscripted
programme.desc: Profiling multitalented writer Nora Ephron. Friends and family discuss the late Ephron's keen wit, her remarkable body of work—which includes everything from newspaper columns to classic films—and her private battle with leukemia. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: You've Got Mail
programme.desc: The owner of a bookstore chain falls for a competitor he meets in an online chat room, unaware she owns a Manhattan shop he's trying to put out of business. Although their online personas get along wonderfully, sparks fly when they meet in person. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Observe and Report
programme.desc: A mentally unstable mall cop competes with a seasoned detective to catch an elusive flasher in this dark comedy starring Seth Rogen. A creep is flashing his goods at Forest Ridge Mall, and Ronnie Barnhardt (Rogen) is on the case. Meanwhile, as Ronnie attempts to earn a spot at the police academy and impress pretty makeup-counter girl Brandi (Anna Faris), scheming Detective Harrison (Ray Liotta) does his best to humiliate the put-upon rent-a-cop with a series of cruel pranks. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Invictus
programme.desc: President Nelson Mandela inspires the South African rugby team to strive for the World Cup in hopes of soothing the country's racial tensions. As rugby captain Francois Pienaar leads his team on a winning streak, the people of South Africa are brought together by their collective desire for a major sports victory. (cc).

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: An employment-agency owner is enlisted to impersonate the President to avoid a scandal when an extramarital dalliance leads to a mishap that puts the commander in chief in a coma. (cc).

programme.title: Kiss Kiss Bang Bang
programme.desc: A struggling actor and crook moves to Los Angeles, hoping to score some movie roles, where he meets a gay PI at a party. When a series of female bodies turn up, they find themselves investigating the murders. (cc).

programme.title: Knight and Day
programme.desc: A single woman and a spy race to elude a federal agent and uncover the truth about a clandestine mission gone awry. Meanwhile, a CIA director attempts to discover why the unlikely duo have taken flight. Extended edition. (cc).

programme.title: Hacksaw Ridge
programme.desc: Biopic about World War II Army medic Desmond Doss, a conscientious objector who refused to take a life or even carry a weapon. Doss was eventually awarded the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of 75 soldiers on the battlefields of Okinawa. (cc).

programme.title: Amelia
programme.desc: This biopic spans the life of aviator extraordinaire Amelia Earhart (Hilary Swank), whose famous voyage across the Atlantic was tragically overshadowed by her mysterious disappearance five years later. Richard Gere, Ewan McGregor. (cc).

programme.title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
programme.desc: During the 1660s, a teenage maid (Scarlett Johansson) in the Netherlands becomes a model for painter Johannes Vermeer (Colin Firth). Absorbing and visually rich; the film nicely captures Vermeer's artistic process. Tom Wilkinson. The film scored three Oscar nominations, including Best Cinematography. Peter Webber's directorial debut. Based on the novel by Tracy Chevalier. (cc).

programme.title: Never Been Kissed
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore enchants as a Chicago newspaper editor who relives her hellish teen years while on an undercover assignment at a local high school. Barrymore's great, but the film celebrates the fact that her character wins over the same type of “in crowd” that taunted her as a teen. David Arquette costars as her cool brother. Raja Gosnell is the director, and Barrymore served as executive producer. (cc).

programme.title: Spring Breakdown
programme.desc: A politician charges her aide with keeping her daughter in tow at a spring-break resort so that she does nothing to embarrass her family, or to jeopardize her mother's career. (cc).

programme.title: Extreme Ops
programme.desc: Extreme-sports enthusiasts run afoul of a slippery terrorist and his henchmen while filming a commercial in the Austrian Alps. Slick action, absurd plot. Devon Sawa, Rufus Sewell, Bridgette Wilson-Sampras. (cc).

programme.title: Hulk
programme.desc: A genetically mutated scientist's alter ego runs amok in this adaptation of the Marvel comic. (cc).

programme.title: Cop Car
programme.desc: Two rebellious young boys steal a police cruiser and go for a joyride. But when they find a dead body in the trunk, they realize they must evade the car's owner, a corrupt small-town sheriff who's desperate to reclaim his property. (cc).

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: Forensics expert Alex Cross investigates the disappearance of a senator's daughter, a student at a prestigious private academy. (cc).

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Boston cop Thomas Craven discovers his grown daughter Emma led a double life after she is shot to death on his doorstep. Craven investigates her murder and soon uncovers evidence of corporate cover-ups and a government conspiracy. Meanwhile, mysterious government agent Darius Jedburgh sets out to erase all evidence of the crime. (cc).

programme.title: Nocturnal Animals
programme.desc: An art-gallery owner reads a novel written by her ex-husband, and becomes greatly disturbed by the possibility that the story was inspired by their marriage and that her safety is in jeopardy. (cc).

programme.title: Rellik
programme.desc: Gabriel and the team deal with the fact that another body has been discovered, seemingly the work of the acid attack serial killer. While questions are raised about Gabriel's suitability to be leading this case, the rest of his team have to step up to the plate and continue the investigation when he is called away on a personal mission that strikes straight at the heart of his family. (cc).

programme.title: Hard Candy
programme.desc: A 14-year-old girl (Ellen Page) and a thirtysomething photographer (Patrick Wilson) connect in an on-line chat room and arrange a meeting in this creepily provocative psychodrama that turns into an unsettling tale of retribution. Sandra Oh, Jennifer Holmes. Directed by David Slade. (cc).

programme.title: The Postman Always Rings Twice
programme.desc: A sleazy drifter gets a job in a Depression-era diner and begins a torrid affair with the owner's much younger wife. The adulterers plot to murder the owner so they can be together. Based on the novel by James M. Cain. (cc).

programme.title: Sleight
programme.desc: A young street magician in Los Angeles becomes a drug dealer in order to provide for his younger sister. But when he runs afoul of his boss, he is forced to use his talent for illusions to free himself from the criminal underworld. (cc).

programme.title: A Monster Calls
programme.desc: A young boy befriends a wise tree monster while coping with bullying and the terminal illness of his mother. He moves in with his grandmother as his mom's condition deteriorates, and uses his imagination and friendship with the monster to escape reality. (cc).

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy named Jake follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities, and learns he is destined to protect them. (cc).

programme.title: Whip It
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore makes her directorial debut with this quirky sports drama about an ex-beauty queen (Ellen Page) who gives up her tiara for roller derby, to the dismay of her mother (Marcia Gay Harden). Kristen Wiig, Juliette Lewis. (cc).

programme.title: Funny People
programme.desc: A struggling stand-up comic befriends a movie star who's dealing with a serious illness and trying to win back the love of his life. (cc).

programme.title: The Medallion
programme.desc: A Hong Kong cop (Jackie Chan) is transformed into a superhuman warrior by an all-powerful amulet. Chan's charm and physical antics compensate for the so-so plot. Chan also co-executive produced. Gordon Chan directed. (cc).

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: Kevin Costner as an ex-Secret Service agent who falls for the pop diva (Whitney Houston) he's hired to protect. Despite the farfetched premise, the movie was a hit with audiences. The splendid soundtrack includes the hit song "I Will Always Love You." Written by Lawrence Kasdan, who penned the script in 1975 as a vehicle for Steve McQueen. Costner co-produced. (cc).

programme.title: Murder by Numbers
programme.desc: Two young boys execute the "perfect" murder, even pinning it on a local crook, but a detective with a disturbed past will not be outsmarted. The boys lie about knowing each other and cover their tracks, but a lack of trust could bring them down. (cc).

programme.title: Birth of the Dragon
programme.desc: In 1964 San Francisco, a pre-fame Bruce Lee challenges a Shaolin monk named Wong Jack Man to a fight behind closed doors. This drama depicts this real-life event, which helped cement Lee's reputation as one of the greatest martial artists of all time. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Birth of the Dragon
programme.desc: In 1964 San Francisco, a pre-fame Bruce Lee challenges a Shaolin monk named Wong Jack Man to a fight behind closed doors. This drama depicts this real-life event, which helped cement Lee's reputation as one of the greatest martial artists of all time. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Sherlock Holmes puts his strength and intellect to the test as he teams with Watson to battle Lord Blackwood, a formidable new adversary who is determined to destroy England. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Eight Below
programme.desc: Thrilling adventure yarn about eight sled dogs struggling to survive when bad weather leaves them marooned at an Antarctic research post. The fact-based film is similar to the 1983 Japanese film "Nankyoku Monogatari," which was released in the U.S. as "Antarctica." (cc).(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision. (cc).(n)

programme.title: About Time
programme.desc: A lonely time traveler meets the love of his life, and attempts to win her heart time and again after a glitch in the process renders them complete strangers. Later, he repeatedly travels back to his past in order to perfect his present. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Knight and Day
programme.desc: A single woman and a spy race to elude a federal agent and uncover the truth about a clandestine mission gone awry. Meanwhile, a CIA director attempts to discover why the unlikely duo have taken flight. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Fugitive
programme.desc: A man who goes on the lam after he's wrongly convicted of killing his wife. As he scours the country looking for the true murderer, he is pursued be a relentless U.S. deputy marshal looking to bring him to justice. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: A team of incarcerated supervillains, including Deadshot, Harley Quinn, Enchantress, El Diablo and Killer Croc, are recruited by the government for a dangerous mission in exchange for reduced sentences. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Once upon a Time in Mexico
programme.desc: A corrupt CIA agent teams up with a guitar-playing gunslinger to stop a coup South of the Border. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: Three female African-American mathematicians provide crucial calculations for NASA's space race against the Soviets, all while dealing with the racist and sexist assumptions of their white co-workers. (cc).

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.
